Rhode Island: s voter identification law was passed by the overwhelmingly Democratic Rhode Island General Assembly.
The bill: s main sponsor in the Rhode Island Senate was Sen. Harold Metts, an African-American.
The House version of the bill was co: sponsored by House Speaker Gordon Fox, the first black lawmaker to lead the state lower chamber.
State Rep: Anastasia Williams, who is of African-American and Panamanian descent, also supported the bill, despite lobbying against it by various organizations.
